content:
On the rustc 1.62.0 nightly I'm getting a miscompile where include_bytes sometimes inlines garbage data into the application.
My project is rather large and the miscompilations happen when I change completely irrelevant parts of the project, so I can't really give an easily replicatable example. Is this a common occurrence on nightly?
Can this be replicated on another machine?
I am asking this because I think it is pretty hard to mess up the implementation of include_bytes, and you probably just have a {broken,corrupted} {compiler,system,memory,disk}.
I'll reinstall and rerun rust too in case any of the toolchain components were corrupt.

I found that it works on a different computer than the one I initially used.
edit: ah.. it was the stb_image crate that was causing a bunch of weird linker issues.
